Partial Page Update

Lesson
objectives ¢ Identify properties associated with dynamic

widget behaviors

¢ Describe common ways to configure a partial
page update

¢ Enable and configure targeted Post On
Change for a widget

Widget properties

| Two kinds of widget properties fa
Static Property Dynamic Property

¢ Evaluates a static value that is ¢ After a user navigates to a page or clicks

immutable, never changes update, evaluates an expression and
,
returns a value
+ id requires a static value . . .
* editable requires boolean expression
* label returns a string expression

* value returns an object expression

Properties: | fe Layout config Reflection PostOnChange
Text Input
Basic properties
editable true
id* FirstName
label Displaykey. get (Training. FirstName")
required

value* (anaBContact as ABPerson) .FirstName

| Dynamic properties evaluate expressions

Available

* Boolean expression which, if false, grays out the widget and its children
Editable

* Boolean expression which, if false, makes the widget and its children read-only
Required

* Boolean expression which, if true, then a value must be filled out by the user
Visible

* Boolean expression which, if false, completely hides the widget and its children

| Example: required fa

aspersonSubtypelnfolnputSetABPerson.pcf *

¢ When the boolean

License Info expression evaluates to
Driver's License|(anABContact as ABPerson).License.. true, the field is required
a
¢ Required is true when

Properties 3] Layout config Reflection PostOnChange LicenseNumber
TypeKey Input

id State

label i

required

value* (anABContact as ABPerso¥) .LicenseState License Info

valueType* typekey. Jurisdiction "A134214342

Example: visible fa

Person Info] Phone & Addresses Financial Summary] [Vendor Info| expression evaluates to

true, the button is visible

| Dynamic property and dynamic behavior fa
Dynamic Property = Dynamic Behavior

« After a user navigates to a page or « While a user changes business data, the

clicks Update, the widget property widget property expression is evaluated

expression is evaluated ¢ Reflects uncommitted data changes

* Reflects committed data ¢ Applicable to the dynamic properties of a

widget
¢ Partial page update configuration required
* Two types:
¢ Layout re-render

* Data only

| Partial page update: Layout re-render fa

« Responds to a user changing business data while it happens and changes the
layout of widgets on the screen

¢« Example:

« While a user changes the Did agent inspect vehicles? field to Yes, a secondary question and
the Date Input widget becomes visible

data while it happens

commit the data

¢« Example:

Name field, values for other fields are
rendered with changes (read-only in Ul)

| Post On Change properties fa
[__—steabiepestonentor = onChange

If evaluated true when page is ¢ Defines a Gosu expression to
rendered, this field won’t trigger Post invoke when user changes the value
On Change of the widget
¢ Default is false * Causes immediate post back to the
server

Review Questions

Question G

_— — Name two properties that evaluate expressions.

4
¢
¢

ee ee a

Answer

_— — Name two properties that evaluate expressions.

4
¢
¢

Possible answers include:
* editable

* required

* visible

* available

SOOO ODD DOOD DODO DOOD

Question G

_- — Howis a partial page update implemented?
4
¢
¢

ee ee a

Answer fa

woe How is a partial page update implemented?
¢
¢

Apartial page update is implemented by configuring dynamic widget behavior by
enabling targeted post on change. Often the dynamic widget behavior configuration
also includes configuring an expression for a widget property.

- SSS SSS SE See

Question G

_- — Whatare the three properties that you can configure for a widget with
¢ targeted Post On Change enabled?

¢
¢

ee ee a

Answer fa

_— — Whatare the three properties that you can configure for a widget with
A targeted Post On Change enabled?

disablePostOnEnter, onChange, and (with earlier InsuranceSuite versions) target.

SOOO ODD DOOD DODO DOOD

Lesson
obj ectives * Identify properties associated with dynamic
review widget behaviors

¢ Describe common ways to configure a partial
page update

¢ Enable and configure targeted Post On
Change for a widget

| Student exercise
